summary: Bruce Willis stars in the action-packed, Sci-fi thriller. Fleeing a devastating plague on Earth, an interstellar ark comes under attack from a new threat; a shape-shifting alien force intent on slaughtering what is left of humanity.

reviews.content: Bas acting, bad action scenes (awfully choreographed), predictable and it has ALL the cliches a movie can have. Lousy writing all over. There are so many things don't make any sense that I am amazed it even made pass the green light.

Its like a copy paste from the worst science fiction, the worst zombie and the worst alien movies. All in one. But they copied only the really bad parts. The actors, the special effects, the story, all feels like no one really cared what they do.  And the end of the movie....... Wow lol
Not even B-movie status. Wiki says it's box office was $39k - that was too much.

It was not good and I do not recommend that. Rather than go into detail about the poor writing, the poor special effects and the poor story, I will say it is a shame that a lot of acting talent is wasted here.
Awful alien movie, so far from being similar to Alien '79. I'm sorry for Bruce Willis, he looks the only acceptable actor. the minimum is half star, otherwise I'd have given -1.
I had to change to another TV Channel, this i the worst acting, plot and special effects I have seen in a very long time.

This is one of the worse movies I haven't ever seen. Everything is bad. The acting, the CGI, the plot‚Ä¶So sad to see Bruce being pet of the awful movie. It is almost a parody of Aliens. Worst CGI ever!

Shouldn't even write so much, but what a waste of a potentially great sci-fi movie Bruce Willis got into. Aliens combined with Walking Dead in a Battlestar Galactica spaceship, full of incredibly advanced tech, but people right out of the 1990s.

La trama, per quanto per nulla originale, riesce comunque a sfruttare l'adrenalina che crea per restare interessante; soprattutto grazie al gioco ad eliminazione dei personaggi, che anche se scontato √® abbastanza ben sviluppato.
I personaggi sono abbastanza interessanti nonostante il poco spazio a loro disposizione.
Ogni sequenza di azione invece √® un totale disastro; montaggio e regia sono pessimi, cos√¨ come le movenze di quasi tutti gli attori; sembra un siparietto teatrale ogni scena; oltre alla poca chiarezza dei comportamenti di praticamente tutti i personaggi secondari.
Rubbish. Absolutely terrible acting. Cheap " special " effects. I gave it a little time , to see if it was one of those " so bad it's good " movies. No.. its just bad !

Quite possibly one of the worst movies I've ever seen. The sets are dodgy, the acting is wooden, the plot is paper thin, the special effects are worse than ‚Äò70s Dr. Who, and the ending is banal. Volunteering for experimental root canal surgery without anaesthetic would be preferable to watching this B movie.
Another low-budget stinker starring Bruce Willis.

Who's responsible for this? Everything is overlit, there's a massive lack of score/music, poor casting and acting, writing is bland for the most part, cinematography is as basic as it comes, so much that it feels like a college thesis if that. Seems to me the director of this film lacks character and personality. Hopefully they learned a great deal from this one, realize why this is a terrible film, and strive to do something a bit storyboarded and planned out next time. My 2 cents: shot list and storyboards. And please practice the use of camera movement. Tired of this point and shoot style of filming.

How do you convince an entire cast to shake and rattle plastic toy guns around with serious commitment believing that it will be made to look cool in post? I feel for the whole cast for being played so badly, terrible, terrible production and god awful film.
An extraordinarily low budget production with bad acting, a terrible script and more cliches than you can count. This is easily one of the worst movies I've ever seen.

Amateurish in all respects with extremely cheap special effects, guns that look like toys and terrible choppy editing in the action scenes.  Weak acting and characters; even Bruce Willis can't be bothered with it.  But it is watchable - the plot is nothing special with no horror or tension and most of the atmosphere comes from the blue lens they put over it, but it picks up in the second half and has a (unintentionally) funny ending.

I think bruce willis must be really broke to act in these trash budget movies.. he must like to see himself on the cover or something. The story was predictable and boring , old fashion trapped in ship with people who are crazy infected . lets hide in thsi room then lets hide in that room , lets make alcohol
Remember the old cheezy B movies ? Welcome to 2021's contribution.
Kind of a ripoff of the Alien movies with an added zombie motif, the movie fails to succeed in either genre.

Such a waste of time! so disappointing, the last third of the film was so hokey!
Better to dig up the old John Carpenter low budget space spoof "Dark Star" (1974) OR Mel Brooks' "Spaceballs" - at least those two movies were intended as entertainment and satire.

Why does Willis keep making so much garbage lately? Who does he owe so much money to?

I would skip this one.  It felt like a low budget movie that somehow captured one big star.  The language was bad (filtered via Vidangel), the acting and story weren't great, and I didn't like the ending.  Only redeeming quality was one man's integrity in trying to do what was right and protect his family at all costs.
I don't know who pissed off Willis before he started this film, but he hammed the alcoholic space mechanic so much, all he needed was a dab of mustard. Turned off halfway through, it's godawful.
Zombies in space. Poorly made zombies at that.
Wow! I've watched some stinkers but this is right up there with the ‚Äòbest' of them. Managed to watch it all the way until the bitter end and now need to self-flagellate.

On Amazon Prime now.  Do not waste your time on the alien slug movie that shows up about 30 minutes into movie. Slightly enters your mouth and you become the walking dead.  Only your no where near as good an actor.  A "D" Rated movie at best.  So I turned off.  A few good old actors that I thought had retired.  I guess they are not   getting offered good parts anymore.   But even in this movie the old timers acting is poor because of the bad script.  It would have been a better movie if the people made it to the new Earth colony and you got to experience them starting a new life. Alien slug is like something out of the old black and white movies of the 50s.
The producer of this movie should be banned from ever making another movie. Don't waste your time.
Badly told, weirdly cut, terribly shot and weak CGI. Low budget? More like no budget.
It didn't take long to determine that this terrible low budget show was going to be  a disaster. It was so bad I had to see the end. It was crap.üëéüëéüëéüëéüëé
I was expecting something like the video game Bruce Willis voiced in 1998 (Apocalypse). Sadly, disappointed. I think watching a homemade abortion video would have been more entertaining.
Absolutely horrible. Not even a B-movie - there is no letter for this kind of waste of time! Bad plot, bad acting, bad EVERYTHING!
Ummmm.... did Bruce have covid when he agreed to this sh#tshow? Pretty sure they filmed it in his basement and backyard, so props to that.
How did they make a film this bad in 2020?
It's bad y'all. Really, really bad.

Sorry but I couldn't get past the screen going all over the place.  I HATE movies where somehow the "Director" seems to think it's "professional".  Anyway, after reading the rest of the reviews, it went in the bin.
This movie was a complete and total waste.  Bruce Willis ... What happened?  An hour and a half of my life I'll never get back.
What a completely stupid movie.  I hung in until the end, being fooled by the audience review count.  It got worse.  Don't waste your time!
I usually enjoy camping sci-fi movies, but this one really missed the mark for me. It was your classic creepy sci-fi bug infection movie, but with poor scripting and plot.
How on earth does this movie have an audience score of 60????? I hate everyone
I am not sure how they convinced Bruce Willis to play in this. Must have been for the paycheck. Terrible flick!!

Grim, formulaic tale with few surprises. Willis‚Äô character is over-the-top unlikable at the beginning who later unsuccessfully tries to win over the audience with a feat of selflessness. The other characters are similarly cardboard. The ending is depressing and does nothing to redeem this movie. Don‚Äôt waste your time.
Wow, if this doesn‚Äôt win some awards I will be surprised! I mean it is Bruce Willis, if you like Bruce than strap in for a wild ride! Also, what else do you have to do?
dumpster fire  of a movie, Willis seemed either drunk or hungover the whole time.
How does stuff like this get made?

Do you play Mothership RPG?  because this movie is right from the pages of that game!  

This is an unpretentious movie that was fun to watch and wasn't trying to be more than it was.  Put extra butter on the popcorn and strap in.

If I had know it only cost $5 to have Bruce in a movie, I would have paid him $6 to reject the role. 

It occupies your time ‚Äî for better or‚Ä¶ likely worse. Predictable and a mix of prior movie plots. You'll laugh, you'll sigh. You'll wonder why you're watching it. Ok to watch if you've seen it all. I hope the cast had actual alcohol to get them through.

I want my $3.99 back. 200 years in the future and we‚Äôre all wearing the same clothes, using a mop and bucket to wash our spaceship, and disguising a cardboard tube as a space laser. And you get to see the same 30 feet of ‚Äúspaceship hallway‚Äù over and over and over again, because there was apparently 0 budget left after paying Willis for his latest embarrassment. Ugh.

It was worse than Ecks Vs Sever. They didn't have the budget for blank rounds so everyone just shook their guns like they were shooting machine guns and the muzzle flash was added in post production, that is when they let the end of the gun actually be in the frame. Most of the important special effects were missing. You could tell that they should have had an FX shot but the edit just switched to reaction shots instead showing the FX shots. They must have lost funding after principal photography so they just cobbled together what they could to put out something rather than nothing. DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME!
Lame attempt at Alien redux. Don‚Äôt waste your time.

Make sure you are drunk as Bruce Willis is in the movie if you decide to watch this thing/passengers mash up. The whole movie is crew members wondering why the pod people don't die when they get shot, so they shoot them again.
Oh my gosh this was BAD. From start to finish...everything was awful. The terrible story, bad effects, awful acting, etc. What a shame.
Definitely not what I expected from a movie with Bruce Willis. Very disappointed.
Not good. Also dumb.

I started off enjoying this film, but it just got sillier. Bad script, lines reused from the 80s-90s films. Bruce Willis seemed to be enjoying himself, taking the P out of this film. Ridiculous ending, acting got worse as film got on.

This movie was bad.
Bruce Willis career has gone down the drajn.
I've seen bad movies...and then this one
Stole concepts from like 10 movies. It didn't work

I wasn't expecting much. Lets face it, Bruce Willis hasn't been in anything good in like 20 years and his straight to Netflix-amazon prime movies are truly bad. But when it was years into the future and I saw the only thing they had to hold back people from going on the space "ark" was a rinky dinky fence that got pushed over, I knew this was going to be worse than I imagined. Was their movie budget twelve dollars? I mean, if you dont go into this with any expectations then you'll enjoy it (if you like no character build up, very very poor special effects, and a terrible script and plot). On the plus side, this was better than Greenland. So Bruce Willis wins the terrible movie race to the bottom over Gerard Butler.

The lack of sense this movie made was appalling. No effort was made to connect any parts of the story together, there was no character development, and thats just the tip of the iceberg. Its as if someone handed a 5 year old a pen and said "write something about space". The fact that movies like this exist make me want to become a script writer, not because it they are good but because i wouldn't need any new skills, i would just write down random things as they came into my head and hope they at least kind of connected to the plot.Painfully horrible.

It was as if someone took campy scenes from different movies and pasted them all together and said "good enough".  Even the monster looked like something from "Star Trek".  Seriously, tell me it isn't familiar.

Just when I thought I couldn't see a more dumb movie after watching Army of the Dead.  I find this gem. 

What a garbage film,  I can't believe Bruce Willis was in this.  Did he owe someone money or something?

There was 0 character development,  I honestly can't remember any of their names.  Bruce's character,  well basically it was just one liners throughout the movie.  It was almost like he told the writers to not worry about building his character,  he'll just play random characters from his past film. 

The special effects were laughable,  everything was fake.  When shooting their guns,  you can tell they were just faking it and they were adding everything later.  The way they would shake the gun as if it was kickback was laughable.  Like something a kid would do during pretend time.  What was with alien that was looked like a liquid terminator?  Why did they even bring that up,  when the ship just blows up 5 seconds later?

The ending made 0 sense,  like I mean 0 sense.  So apparently they make it to Earth 2 and I guess the aliens were there too?  Why was there a building sized alien in the background.   And these 2 actually think their flamethrower is going to work?  Was that supposed to be a setup for a sequel?  

oh almost forgot they reused the same scenes over and over.  There is a scene where the zombie aliens were trying to get into a room.  They would reuse the door being pounded in,  like 10 times.  Each time,  the door is back to normal and 'pound'  it's indented.  Then next scene back to normal,  pounded in.  Repeat.  Over and over and over. 

Movies out of Hollywood these past couple years have been such a waste of time.  I can't believe someone actually read this script and green-lit it!

Oh no, I nominate Breach for worst movie of the pandemic. The production quality is so... so... baaaad. I swear they filmed some of this movie in an abandoned Mexican restaurant. The cryogenic sleep chambers were a mix of plywood, pvc pipe and recycled aluminum windows. The hyperdrive engine looked the knight rider tail light. The writing was terrible. The editing was bad. They re-use a lot of useless closeups.
Slow, predictable plot. Poorly written and acted even worse.

Why? Seriously, why? Why make this film???... 
What I just saw is one of the most insanely idiotic pointless films that I have ever seen. At no point in its rambling, incoherent screenplay was it even close to anything that could be considered a rational thought. Everyone in this room is now dumber for having watched it.  I award it no points, and may God have mercy on their souls.
Terrible movie.  I can't believe Bruce Willis signed on to this pile of crap.
Waste of time, not very scary. Kinda dumb and the effects were lacking.

Just...what on (or off) Earth was that?!
How did they get so many decent actors to take part in such an appalling film? And to act just as poorly..

Just...no.

Do not waste your time seeing this movie. 
Worst Movie I have ever seen. Worst Acting by Bruce Willis and Many Other Actors.

I'm speechless. Maybe this will be a B rate classic on the new earth.  The one thing that sticks in my mind is the cryogenic chamber doors with their high tech brass hinges and plexiglass. 

This could have been a good movie if they would of had a different director, editor, actors, story, blah, blah, blah.

Horrible movie, complete waste of time. Bruce Willis must be desperate for cash to have been in this movie.  Looks like it was created by amateur film makers. Graphics were silly. When the hero's climb out of their pod it looked like it was made from painted cardboard.  20% critics rating is extremely generous.

Felt like Bruce Willis and Thomas Jane wanted to see who could pull of their hoaky lines the worse. All the while, watching the ship sink. Terrible special effects, and the sound effects further prove the low budget. This wouldn't be so bad, if the story were a little better.

Many technologies and techniques have been lost to time, and in the future reality of this film mankind has completely lost the knowledge of headshots. Okay, one can argue that zombie movies aren't nearly as popular in the future and therefor people being attacked by space worm super zombies wouldn't know that a shot to the head is needed to put them down, but after entire squads empty round anfter round into their foes' chests with absolutely no effect you would think that someone would try aiming for a different vital area. This goes on for the whole movie and by the end of the film not even one stray or ricocheted round strikes a zombie in the head.

That alone is enough to make the movie laughable if not unbearable, but stilted dialogue and wooden acting, bad special effects, and set design that uses a lot of shipping containers and packing materials painted gray sink this turd to the bottom of the septic tank where it belongs.
When there is a critic/audience split I hate to be on the critic's side BUT this film is a total stinker. It's just another zombie apocalypse.

An attempt for a B Movie that takes itself too seriously... Take Bruce Willis out and you have to turn off the TV after 20 min.  This movie must have had 3 writers in 3 different rooms.  The last 30 seconds make it an epic B-Rate ending though :) I was LMAO.
Absolutely atrocious.

Meh, passed the time, the two star description is a perfect description. Decent to poor effects, lot of running around with monsters. Not one original idea, and plenty of dumb ones. If you spend a couple million on a film, why not spend a couple grand on a script? Weird.

Really bad acting. Even worse special effects. It's supposed to be a new interstellar colony ship, but the set looks more like the men's room in a seedy strip club. Almost like they were trying to imitate the set of the ship in Alien. Matter of fact it's like they were trying to make an Alien meets Leviathan movie. But without the good acting and sets. The script probably had some potential. But this is definitely a low budget movie. Like, $29.95 and a McDonald's gift card budget...

This is just appalling. Looks like most of the budget went on Bruce Willis and even he wasn't worth it. Acting is awful on all counts. FX are laughable. Sets are literally falling apart as you watch the movie.  There's just no excuse for this nonsense.
One of the worst movies ever. Bruce Willis must have lost a bet. Straight up Horrible!

Wow....after 10 min I questioned if this was as bad as I thought it was. It was.....but worse. How/why Bruce Willis would agree to be in this movie is beyond me - other than an easy few million I assume.
Despite its promising cast, I'm disappointed.
Just boring. Premise has been done before. Had a few cool shots but def not worth it.
Wow, what an awful film! The acting was stiff and like there wasn't any real commitment to any of the characters. We stuck it out to give it a full chance but wouldn't recommend it to anyone!
Terrible, predictable. I'm actually shocked at how bad the movie was.

Don't waste a second of your life on this giant reeking piece of crap. Worst movie I've seen in 20 years. Always been a huge Bruce Willis fan but those days are obviously over. Don't know if he's on drugs, should be on drugs, has had a massive stroke that caused brain damage, or what the deal is, but his acting in this is so bad it can't really be called acting.

There was some cheeky character introductions off the hop - namely the Fonzy-like persona of the Admiral; the drunk, tough-guy custodian (Bruce Willis); and the bad guy (why was he even bad?). However these characters were not developed and all killed off in very abrupt fashion, no build up to their deaths. The movie started off interestingly enough, but lacked in detail. The further into the movie we got, it seemed like production ran out of money... it got cheaper and cheesier right to the bitter end. Very hard to watch Bruce Willis in this one. If I could rate it negatively I would. It was so bad it is almost comical. Don't waste your time on this movie... woof!

I guess all the bad audience reviews are because it wasn't ‚Äòwoke' enough.  This is one of the better space-horrors to come along in recent years.  Some of the science in this sci-fi throwback of sorts can be questioned, but all-in-all it's got what fans of sci-fi, horror, and action movies crave and doesn't mess with the delivery.  No poetic musing of the artistic beauty of the vast unknown of the cosmos and our future in it as one harmonic species, just blowin' shit up on a spaceship infested with parasitic aliens.

A sci - fi almost as good as Ishtar, although Ishtar has interesting scenery (desert scenes). The only interesting part was the credits.
Bruce Willis was a hope, but ended up hopeless.
Beware.

Why did Thomas Jane even bother to be in this for all of 10 minutes? I concur with the Bruce comments. 
It could have been better, but it felt rushed. The backstory was the usual "humans bad."

The brand is all about the trust. And I had trust in Bruce. Not only because for most part he never let me down, and not only because some say that I look a bit like him but also because he did deliver some remarkable and memorable roles. So, led by the brand, my loyalty to the brand and my six sense, I made that faithful life changing decision and hit the "buy" button. I am now a proud owner of the "license for life" that entitles me to watch the movie Anti Life any time I want. 

The thing is, I do not really want to watch it. And this feeling is so strong and is supported by the fact that, even considering that I am stingy, and that I do value my money (actually I value it a lot) I still didn't find the strength and courage to continue watching it. I did try at least three times, after all I am a loyal follower. In my life on this planet, which now spans over the five decades, I have walked away from a sci-fi movie only twice. The first movie I cannot even remember the name, it belongs to the category of life events that you want to remember extremely well just to be sure that you will forget every single moment of it. And now is the second time. Anti-Life. 

In a way, this is a life changing event for a couple of reasons. Firstly, this is one of those creations that make you think, if they did it, I can certainly do at least the same. In this particular instance, I am sure I would do much better. Secondly, I have never ever written a review of anything, I have never returned a meal in a restaurant or a bottle of wine just to prove that I am a connoisseur. I always thought that I would offend somebody who tried hard to deliver the best outcome. 

But this thing, is just so bad that even a person like me is kind of offended. Plot is na√Øve, events even more so, dialogs are, well I am not even sure how to describe them. You see, in any story or a movie it doesn't even matter if the plot is realistic but it has to be logical and believable. And this one is neither. I do not even want to talk about the acting, the fact is they did their best with what they were given. 

And here I can to the main point. They did their best with they were given is actually not the way to describe the problem. They did their best with what they decided to accept. And that leaves me with one question. Why? Why did you do this to me Bruce? We had a great ride you and I. 

So, I paid 49 UAE Dirhams. If the equation "time equals money" holds true than money is the time. So, Bruce you own me the time. My time that I used to earn 49 Dhs and my time spent trying to watch this movie. That is all I am asking for, give me my time back.

The only thing that is absolutely brilliant about this movie is the title "Anti Life". Anti my life and anti your life. So, please do not watch for your life's sake. Not even if this is the only movie showing for free on a boring long-haul flight (which are not that many these days anyway).

I have never seen a movie that was so unimpressive despite having such fantastic actors. Everything about the movie seemed fake and forced, the acting was rigid and not at all immersive. Do not watch.
I really don't have anything good to say about this...movie? Except thank God it had an ending!!
Don't bother worst space alien film rip off ever, can't believe I just watched 1hr 30mins, even Bruce Willis is poor in this film.

With a couple of promising actors including Bruce Willis it seemed like a reasonable title to watch whilst away on business and bored. The low-fidelity effects at first were not that bad and you could clearly see the cheap perspex screens and wood panelling on the set, I let that go. The plot started meh ok and got progressively worse with nothing new or novel and relying on the viewer knowing how space alien films worked. I found myself willing it to end over the last 20 minutes with nothing redeeming, original or entertaining. All in all a waste of time and most disappointing.

Terrible.  These veteran actors don't bother to up the game to save this awful movie. The plot, sets, space ship design and especially the effects are terrible.
Man #1 explodes and covers Man #2 with blood.  But we don't see it happen, we just see Man #2 showered with Kensington Gore.  There is editing to save money and there is not showing things that people need to see to feel the impact of the events.
There aren't many movies that I walk out of, but I switched this off about 70 minutes in because going back to work was more appealing.
What a disappointment.  Come on Bruce.....

Well that's 2hrs of my life I'm never getting back, the entire film feels like Alien mixed with Resident evil mixed with die hard and thats it, this is the definition of yeah you can copy my homework but change it a bit so it don't look to obvious. Don't waste your time with this one Bruce must be desperate at this point to be doing crap like this now. How this film supposedly got nearly 50% google viewers positive reaction n 60% on here I will never know.

Have  you ever seen that moviein which people are on a spacecraft with an unknown monster on board  picking them off one by one? Well here it is again in another boring monster film masquerading as sci-fi.
Worst Scifi ever. So bad that it's worth seeing

Ok, I just started watching it  but üòÇüòÇüòÇthis woman use left earth on a giant spaceship together with lots of other people but the boyfriend's woman, she looks outside from a porthole and she can see earth obviously already hundreds of thousands miles away, she turns around and dramatically asks "how do I get off this ship" üòÇüòÇüòÇüòÇ
Doesn't  take itself too seriously in fact I wasn't  sure if it was being played for laughs. It's a budget Alien knock off. It's not terrible. But it's not great either.
Up until the alien parasite all was good and I did enjoy the movie but alien-onwards all turned into a low budget movie. Feel sorry for Bruce Willis

Is Willis short of money? Did he do this for a bet? Has someone got pictures of him with farm animals (which would surely be less embarrassing than this ‚Äòmovie'). 

Hands down, far and away the worst movie ever. Bar none. And I sat through The Waterboy!

How did this get 70% Audience fresh, this is terrible. The sets the acting the fucking sound for god's sake, 10 mins in and I just couldn't take it anymore. This isn't so bad it's good. It's like your dog chewed up your Alien DVD and then threw up on your shoes.
Utter crap. Even the producer and director will want to put as much space as possible between themselves and this drek

Another Bad Bruce Willis movie in a long line of Bad Bruce Willis movies.  Profoundly unoriginal, profoundly bad.  If you start with a bad script, add bad directing, bad acting, and bad cinematography, it is highly likely that you will end up with a bad movie (Gordon's Theorem).  Hollywood still hasn't taken it to heart yet.

It's not for the artsy folk, it's a movie that you sit back and laugh at. I like the idea, and the pacing was good, however as others have said CGI and script was lacking. I still recommend it to those looking to have a good time because I was not bored one second watching this movie. I even got invested in the characters a bit near the end. What else could you want from a film but entertainment?

I haven't had this much fun in a long time. I mean... we made fun of it the whole time. It was like every actor was walking around wearing a roast me sign. Writing... directing... cinematography... all hilarious.  A must see.
I really wanted to enjoy this movie but it was truly terrible.

So, I have to admit I saw Bruce Willis and Thomas Jane on the cover, this is gotta be a good movie. It had the chick from Continuum also, I'm like heck yes, let's go. Whoa, maybe its a slow build? üòï nope. I question, are these actors struggling cause of Covid? Naw, maybe it was a close friend making a directoral debut? Oh God, let's hope. I just seen Nicholas Cage doing some crappy movie about a possessed Chuckie. WHY ARE THESE A LIST ACTORS doing this? Lol. Oh well, its was basically watching a SyFy movie with better graphics and a famous actor cameo.
The most entertaining part of this movie was watching the credits!!!! Save yourself the pain of watching this load of rot! You have been warned!!!!!
Terrible, complete waste of time.
Why was this movie made?
Truly unimaginative, super low budget, nothing ventured nothing gained.
Film could of been better, good entertainment No sex no nudity. Recommended  to family to watch it ..
This is far the worst movie i ever seen. Bruce Willis making more and more  very bad movies, too sad

I can't imagine why Bruce Willis signed up for this movie.  I usually like his movies.  But this one.. was the worse I've ever seen.  The video typography was awful, the acting was forced and the special effects we amateurish.  That monster at the end was just terrible.  Don't waste your time watching this

low budget and ridiculous story line and terrible acting - Worst movie of the year - 
bruce must be desperate
Oml! Low budget and over acting sums up this disaster. If this movie was shown in the 80s it still would be crap. How did they get Bruce Willis to do this?

Seriously! What an embarrassment for Thomas Jane to be involved in this low rent trash.....Bruce Willis once again hits the career suicide pedal to the floor. What an insult. I want my ¬£5.49 back üò†
It's Alien, only, done really badly. Do not waste your time or your "free movie a month" voucher from perk box. It's too late for us, but you guys still have time to make the right decision.

Simply, a disaster!

I'd like to rate it below 0, if only I could.
It's not a sci-fi to me and sadly it's not even a joke.

Who wrote the script? Who did the casting? Who created special effects?
Why would anyone want to release this "thing" to general audience at all?

TV series in 90's are better than this. Metropolis from 1927 is way better.
A total waste of time, money and digital space. Let's forget this thing ever existed.
I can honestly say it will be the worst movie of the millenium...

I generally like bruce willis movies, this is a sub B movie at best. I bet he regrets doing this one a lot. the special effects were mediocre at best, story like reminded me of aliens but not done as well. the "set" seemed well done. humfp the story was terribly done!

I want my $5.99 back. For someone that loves science fiction, and often roars with laughter at B-movies, this was actually painful to watch. Production was bottom dollar. Gray paint was everywhere (my guess a cousin's warehouse), some cheap ass Styrofoam props here and there, I'm guessing drag racing plastic seats for everyone to sit in...to make matters worse the alien effects were offensively bad. Near the end it was like watching a bad Thanksgiving day parade float gliding down the corridor. Acting was so wooden I was pulling splinters out of my eyes. Willis does a lot of these straight to demand movies nowadays, but I could see the regret in his eyes for this one. I'm guessing he had real liquor in that flask just to get through the scene shots. Probably sat between takes with his harmonica, lamenting the blues. The best part was the end when he blew up the ship and it was all over. Thank you Bruce, for destroying the ship and preventing any chance of a sequel.

Of the many Bruce Willis fantastic films. Thought this might be similar to the Fifth Element which was obviously epic. 

This is the Jar Jar Binks of Bruce Willis up there with Four Rooms. Four rooms was better though had a story.

‚ÄòMe thinks a bada boom big badda boom'

Why Bruce why? Are you that broke ? 
Dirty grungy space passengers who never eat or sleep fight off an alien invasion on a cryo ship, Bruce says at one point when he sees bits of goo and gore ‚Äòyou've got be f......ing kidding me!' 
I agree.
Derivative, unfocused and  really bad.  An awful hackjob of a script. I can't imagine why someone would  waste actual money making this picture.
Please don't bother wasting your time watching this awful movie. I can't believe Bruce Willis put his name to it
Cheesy, not very original, but fun.  If you like seeing Bruce do his thing, you'll like this.  Not going to win best picture, but that's not the point with a movie like this.
Terrible, no plot, no story, no memorable characters. Why, why, why? What a waste of Thomas Jane.

Doesn't even deserve 1 star. Bruce WHY?
 Have you ever watched a movie that made you want to end your life?

The writing couldn't have been worse, The FX were horrible, The storyline atrocious, Gives garbage a bad name.
 I never even wanted to review a movie until this pile of steaming...
 It will take me days to get over this wretched feeling.
 Did this movie give me Covids?

Pandemic film making hit a new low, could do better cgi on my Commodore 64, the plot thinner than a Duralex, disappointed that Bruce Willis would sign on for such a mess but I guess with no real movies being filmed even he could use a buck. Do not watch!! Makes a bad B movie look like an Oscar contender
Really one of the worst movie of Bruce Willies. The effects and scenogrsphy are cheaper. The story very simple without in-depth development
Not even so bad, it's good.

If you want to watch a good space movie, watch "2067", it's nearly identical to this one but is actually good. This movie is absolutely terrible. Terrible plot. Terrible effects. And even worse acting.
This movie was proper kak. The cgi to the acting and even the camera man... Dude I would almost rather watch Megan foxes awful rogue movie again that this piece of garbage

I like Bruce WIllis as an actor. You usually, know with his movies what you're gettingi into. I did not know what I was  getting into with this movie. Terrible doesn't even beginning to descripbe it. The plot, the acting, the writing, and everything else stinks. This isnt even a third rate movie. I couldn't get passed 45mines of the movie before switching it to something else. Even then, I was annoyed I'd wasted 45mins watching this junk. Don't watch it. I'm doing you a favor.
The $1.80 redbox would have been fine. But it was so forgettable! I forgot to return it and it's costing me more!
I could not even make it past the first 10 minutes. It is so low budget and terribly executed. Felt like I was watching some straight to dvd movie from the $1 bin.

Worst sci-fi movie in ages. Bad script, bad FX, acting so-so, cheap Alien rip off, confusing, just simply awful. Oh, and a really bad 50s B-movie monster which was not scary but laughable. Terrible movie.

2.5 out of 5 stars. Breach is a science fiction action film about a space crew on an interstellar voyage to a new earth to start over. They come across some parasite creature that infects a person. And spreads towards others. The plot is decent. Concept of a space crew coming across something on the ship. That turns a person into a mindless mutant. And a monstrous creature in the end that is trying to consume life. There are other better films like this such as Pandorum. Alien. The direction in this film is terrible. Characters do make dumb decisions. The writing is cheesy and dumb. The acting is stale. It does have a great cast ensemble of actors that were in old action movies. Like Bruce Willis. Johnny Messner. And Thomas Jane whos performance who wears aviators shades inside a spaceship. Cody Kearsley performance is stale. Everyone is wasted in a bad script. The film also lacks thrills and suspense. The action is forgettable. The cliffhanger ending is entertaining.

Seriously, a horrible movie.  Lousy script, terrible music, and some of the worst acting I have seen in last 24 months.   The only reason Bruce Willis is in this movie is to try to give it some creditability in hopes people think it could be worth wasting their time on.  Not sure why he keeps taking on movies like this other than money. Last GOOD movie he did was Once Upon a Time in Venice (2017).  Everything else is garbage.

Come on BRUCE!
with bruce willis and a low rating from holly wood art types, THIS will be a great movie to see!
Was created by high school students
A mishmash of sci-fi horror tropes, but the ending almost makes it worth it.

The people rating this poorly and writing online journal reviews have no idea why it is fantastic and its lost on them. What they don't get is this movie is the mobile game Among Us. It constantly references it from saying lets airlock the stowaway to blue did it with multiple emergency meetings and going in the vents. I have read online reviews from older people who don't like it because they completely miss this fact and have no idea about the game. If you like the game it's a must watch.

Overall, those seeking a brainless B grade sci-fi story will generally find some joy and entertainment with Breach, but I do feel it's only for a selected group of movie lovers. Surprisingly enough, my biggest disappointment with Breach is the awful film ending. Not only is the choice of the image quality during the ending ugly, but the ending also makes no sense. Instead, I was left feeling as though my entire time watching the film was wasted, and I was left feeling frustrated - Walkden Entertainment
If you can keep both eyes open through its whole movie  you're a better man than I am.
Top 3 worst films ever seen. Not a Willis fan but was bored and lazy....he's paid to do nothing. Dialogue is awful, special affects are middle school level. Brutal waste of time, dodge the bullet.

OMG Bruce, you just hit an all time low. I hope the money (assuming the budged had room to pay you) was worth killing your career over. I am a Bruce fan and have been since Moonlighting but I'm left speechless that he agreed to act in this movie. The effects must have been done on an old Sinclair Spectrum computer, the story line horrible and acting even worse, including Bruce¬¥s. I could not stop laughing at the end when the two "heroes" are getting away in a life pod as the main ship blows up behind them and they both turn around to see it with the only windows on the pod on the front, hahahahahaha. YCMTSU......

Yet another movie using big names to attract viewers to a dire offering. The movie looks to have been filmed in a basement/boiler room, with bad chi and wobbly sets. Acting is B movie at best and dialogue is lacking in any form of depth. Think Bruce has decided a check is s check and will now appear in anything. 

It's an hour and a half of my life that would have been more enjoyable at the dentist.
With this cast, it should have been so much more.

I guess some actors are real hard up for money during covid times. Or, maybe they are just trying to be part of what they think might be a B-movie cult hit. It is just bad. I have literally seen better movies made by tic tock people. lol
You can always tell how bad a movie is going to be in it's first 15 minutes. Lazy sets and costume designs. Bad acting at times laughable. The whole thing shot on an iPhone.
weak effects and gun play, cool plot idea even if has been re-used.
Horrible movie, i will never look at Bruce Willis the same after being in such a bad filmüò≠

A movie to pass the time, but don't expect much. The acting is surprising good (except for Thomas Jane who play the Admiral) but the subpar set design, bad CG and poorly written script leaves you wishing you made different life choices two hours before.  Several times it teased me into thinking it was about to get good - but NOPE - fizzled out again. Thank God for Bruce Willis & a flame thrower‚Äîmakes everything better.
Poorly done effects, with terrible screenplay, a wild plot line that ended the movie with no closure to the story.

I was bingewatching in a sleepless night and I saw it and said ok lets try it and it was pretty good, it has action, nice plot and it was more thatn I expected. Good for passing time and I recommend it.

you like guns? i give you guns. you like alien? I give you alien. you like Bruce Willis? i give your Bruce Willis. but thats all you get no story no plot just guns alien and Bruce Willis. hell they even try to make it seem like hes not the main character. If you spent any money on viewing this movie then i would recommend asking for it back as this is one of the worst films ive seen in years.
Big oof, really boring. The director's 13 year old cousin did the Visual Effects in exchange for a credit in the film.
Can I please have my 1.5 hrs back please.  Just a plain bad movie.

It is a horrible movie. Basically it is a copy of Alien with a much worse production. I can't believe Bruce Willis is willing to take part in this movie. There is no acting for him. He basically swears from time to time. A waste of time.
I wish I could that time back..  Worst movie EVER...   I want to give it a -5 stars..  I can't believe I watched it till the end..
I mean, I didnt hate it? I knew what i was getting into. The acting is surprisingly good, the downfall is the CGI.

Who knows how or why this abomination got made. Certainly, it's a bad script; the production design and execution is abysmal; the props looks like toys from a reject shop, and the performances are uninspired. It might have been framed as a comedy somehow, and re-scripted with writers, possibly, and got up to one star. It's when we see this kind of travesty that we wonder what passes for green-lighting a film in the corridors of places that films are shopped around like candy corn that got stepped on by trick-or-treaters wearing fanciful waffle-stompers and then die from a sad, ugly, disease and disappear.

I never thought I'd see Bruce Willis in a B movie, is his next co-star going to be Pauly Shore? While not classified as a B movie I comes off as one. The acting for the most part is either horrid or below average at best for all but one of the actor/actresses. CGG is below average obviously the budget was spent on actor/actress wages more precisely Bruce Willis, and he does give an above average performance, nothing near his peak but still better than the rest of the cast. If your set on watching this or have nothing better to do, I'd recommend waiting for it to be free viewing on you local network and not buying or renting it. I love a good SYFY but if you were to compare it to other movies with the best of Star Trek or Star Wars movie's being a 10 out of 10 (not saying they are just a reference point) this would fall in around a 3-4 with Disney's Blackhole at a 2, yes their are worse than that one out there.
It was pretty then i thought it would be for the b movie quality. i thought it was fun through the whole film.

One of the worse movies I've seen and one of the few I actually couldn't sit all the way through.  I skipped to the end to see if it was interesting and it's the expected bad ending.  Scifi effects are terrible...worse than some amateur movies I've seen.  Acting is pretty terrible despite the famous actors/actresses.
OMG the cgi was ü§¢ü§¢ü§¢ü§¢ü§Æ everything about the movie was lazy. Lazy storyline

Lordy... I don't know why Bruce would be in this, but... Bad CGI, embarrassing performances from not well known actors AND well known actors. It is a low budget greenscreen wreck that is pretty sloppy. I mean... the ending shot doesn't even make sense physically. Two camera angles didn't make sense and just looked goofy at the VERY end. Give it a pass unless you just like watching bad/boring movies ironically, I guess.
Bruce should be embarressed, unbelievable!

If you stay up every year to watch the campy, B movie holiday slasher films i.e. "Santa Slays" you might make it through this. I gave it an extra 1 and 1/2 stars because of how much fun my 10 year old niece an I had cracking jokes throughout the entire thing. The acting was as bad if not worse than the 1991 quality CGI effects. The storyline is at best predictable and if I'm honest our ending idea was better. I like B movies so I don't regret watching it but I do regret the loss of the $6 I payed to rent it.

Sad. Bruce is now in the, sub par, SyFy original category.
I guess everybody needs to make a house payment somehow.

What a piece of crap! This isn‚Äôt even science fiction. The plot isn‚Äôt worthy of an elementary student. There would be no alcohol and no tobacco on the ship. NO ONE would get on the ship by chance or without significant training. It is not even produced well enough to be scary.

Because of covid i already lowered my bar in regards to movies and series and i also didnt expect much from this Alien/The Thing inspired sci-fi beforehand but... WOW this was bad. Every single aspect of the movie was below par or just plain bad. I am truly amazed they managed to trick these actors into participating.

Wow!!! I appears that either Bruce Willis is either purposefully going out of his way to play in what I believe anyone would consider a low low low budget bunch of B movies, OR, one if his kids is having a go at writing movies scripts and he's doing what he can to help them through the trial and error process. This is an absolutely FANTASTIC movie if you're just looking to have a little background noise as you go about your day. But as far as sitting down to actually watch it? Very painful.....but fun too, in a weird, I like B movies kind of way.
I don‚Äôt think this will be considered a movie.

I love Bruce Willis, but this movie was like a poor man's Alien.
They tried to make this a good movie by using the appeal of Bruce Willis but it just wasn't enough for this poorly made film.
it had potential at the beginning, but the last 20 minutes were hard to watch, very bad acting , it looked as if a 12 year old had filmed this with his 11 year old friends, in a garage
One of the worst movies I've ever seen

What in the world is going on with Bruce Willis movie's ? I don't think he's getting much of a fair shake from the Hollywood elite these days and it makes one wonder if its due to his political stance that he has made clear in the past . We need the old "Die Hard" Bruce Willis back . Sorry I got a bad stomach ache from this one. Can someone pass me the cheese whiz.

Horrifically bad. Painfully obvious this was a quick Willis paycheck.

The script sounds as if it was written in an evening. The sets were just one step above 'Plan 9 From Outer Space' and the practical effects were painful to watch WHEN they were shown. The director often makes the obvious decision to cut away to an actor's reaction to certain actions in the film to save money.
This has to be in be one of the worst movies I have ever seen with Bruce Willis in. I could only suffer 20mins it was embarrassing
WTF was THAT ????? !!!!!

"Breach" answers the age-old question "What's the best movie you can make with a budget of $350.00?" Actually I gave this a negative 4 stars, so that means the next few movies I watch will start out in the hole. This was cheesy-bad, from the styrofoam set, to the 1950's antagonists, to the implausible storyline. Willis was Willis... pulling out every sneer and sarcastic smile from his earliest work. The rest of the cast were at best B-actors with a few C's thrown in to make the laugh-out-loud requirement for such an awful film.
The bad reviews of this movie aren't bad enough to describe how bad it is.
What started as a cool premise turned into a bad post-production of bad lines and bad acting.
Horrible movie. Horrible story. Complete wast of time.
This movie is awful and I am a huge Bruce Willis fan. I would not recommend this movie at all. The alien was the worse special effects ever!
That was one of the worst things I have seen in my lifetime.  It made me wonder who Bruce Willis owed a favor to. Just so bad it should be renamed The Poo.

Not just bad....terrible.  I'm embarrassed for Bruce Willis and Thomas Jane.
This movie made me go an mow the lawn. Yes, it's boxing day and I would rather mow the lawn than watch this tripe!
A sci-fi B-movie self admittedly, but was surprised to see Thomas Jane and Bruce Willis in it....Your time is much better spent on re-watching the Aliens series than this turd.

This movie is utter garbage. The acting is bad. Even Bruce Willis is acting bad? The settings look like something made in home class for a 6th grader. The CGI is awful. This is a b movie in every sense, but without the charm you find in a few of them.
Its boring, Its lame, its a complete waste of time. How did they get Bruce Willis to "act" in this crap? He was one of the greatest action heroes. He was John Mclaine in Die hard. And now this??? WFT. Alien, wich was made 41 years before this movie, is a 1000 times better in all aspects. Avoid this crap. And Bruce...why???

I enjoyed this movie.  During the course of watching,, first I thought it was a knockoff of Alien, but as it progressed and at the end it reminded me more of Army of Darkness. Wow this is baaaaad! Think Star Trek TOS special effects, the local acting class meeting once a month then you squeze in Bruce Willis and you get this movie. B class dont even cover it. Bruce what happend?

Really bad movie! I lost 45 min of my life I will never get back. The special effects sucked! The alien zombie [whatever they were supposed to be] was really bad! I thought my wife put this on to punish me for something i did wrong. Please DON'T watch this movie! If you do, your eyes will burn! That bad!
This movie was ridiculously bad, almost in a funny way. Graphics and content were terrible. I think Bruce Willis has finally become too desperate to care.
Moonlighting had better special effects. It was a B sci-fi movie at best. Bruce Willis must be hurting for money to have done this movie. Wait until it is free.
Terrible.  I couldn't wait to rate this poorly.  It's truly a mix between a lame version of "Alien" and "The Walking Dead".  Don't waste your time.

I so wish I could give this movie a better rating, but nope. I had high hopes for what I thought would be the next Aliens or Predator but my hopes were dashed almost immediately from the very start. It was bad. Probably worse than you‚Äôre thinking even.

What did I just watch?  I thought because of the cast this would be a decent sci fi film but this was more of a cheap and corny version of a zombie movie mixed in with the Alien and Godzilla franchises. Special effects were crude. Writing was not believable.
This movie sucked!  Pls don‚Äôt waste your time money or intelligence on this trash.
Wait until you can see this for free.  I wish I had.
Ok for a Saturday night date out. You can wait until it arrives on Netflix.

Managed to watch the whole movie in about 5 minutes. From the get go it is total rubbish. I then skipped through to the end to see the even worse ending. Bruce presumably getting some stocking filler money for appearing in this total drivel. 

Do not waste even the 5 minutes I did with this awful movie, it isn't even B-movie entertainment bad, just totally miserable, poorly acted, useless special effects, no plot, massive leaps in logic, waste of humanity.

For the love of god Willis, retire ! It's been a bad year, for obvious reasons, but it has allowed dross like this to stream to the world. It's set in 2242, that's 222 years from now and in the first 5 minutes we have riot fences, beany hats and combat jackets from WWII. The last craft takes off to the violin tone of Nostromo in Alien.
